definition: straight/erect/to stick out (a part of the body)/to (physically) straighten up/to support/to withstand/outstanding/(coll.) quite/very/classifier for machine guns
to go forward/to advance/to go in/to enter/to put in/to submit/to take in/to admit/(math.) base of a number system/classifier for sections in a building or residential compound

sentences.english: The troops attacking frontally would do so with more enthusiasm .
sentences.chinese: 担任正面进攻的部队会士气更高地向前挺进。

sentences.english: They sweep toward the Hallelujah mountains in a thundering wave.
sentences.chinese: 他们雷鸣般地向哈利路亚山挺进。

sentences.english: Once the vastly more experienced Yugoslavia stopped laughing, they rattled in four themselves to progress to the next round.
sentences.chinese: 经验丰富的南斯拉夫队趁机又连进四球，挺进下一轮。

sentences.english: Our soldiers advanced bravely against the enemy.
sentences.chinese: 我们的士兵勇敢地向敌人挺进。

sentences.english: Despite the snow storm they persisted in marching ahead.
sentences.chinese: 尽管有大风雪，他们还是坚持向前挺进。

sentences.english: Spain finds its flair to reach WCup final.
sentences.chinese: 西班牙找到他们的优势，挺进世界杯冠军赛。

sentences.english: We know how to move forward.
sentences.chinese: 我们知道如何向前挺进。

sentences.english: The ship bored on through the big waves.
sentences.chinese: 这艘船在狂涛骇浪中挺进。

sentences.english: The Chinese and Cubans will both advance to the quarterfinals.
sentences.chinese: 中国队和古巴队将共同挺进四分之一决赛。

sentences.english: The 7th Infantry Division was to complete its advance to the Yalu.
sentences.chinese: 第7步兵师的任务是完成挺进鸭绿江的行动。

sentences.english: We blasted it with two shots. Then we went up the hill along with the infantry.
sentences.chinese: 我们朝房子开了两炮，然后和步兵一起向小山挺进。

sentences.english: The Khan was quickly advancing towards the Russian capital without stopping for pillaging or taking captives.
sentences.chinese: 汗迅速朝露西亚首都挺进，不为掠夺和携带俘虏停留。

sentences.english: A fast moving planet is a potent one, but Mars was anything but speedy or potent.
sentences.chinese: 快速挺进的行星才强大有力，而火星与此隔若天壤。

sentences.english: The general commanded his men to advance.
sentences.chinese: 将军命令他的士兵向前挺进。

sentences.english: With his forces increased by many thousands Liu pressed south.
sentences.chinese: 刘的部队增加了数千名新兵，继续向南挺进。

sentences.english: Another young Twilight upstart with his top off sneaking his way into the Empire sexiest list?
sentences.chinese: 又一个新晋无上衣秀暮光男挺进《帝国》最性感名单？

definition: to collaborate/to join forces/to effect a junction
to break a siege/to break out of an enclosure
like a hot knife through butter (idiom)/with irresistible force
to advance boldly/to push ahead vigorously
to advance singing loudly (idiom); triumphant progress
to win as a result of tenacious effort/to fight off tough competition
